response.job_title: Mechanical Engineer specialized in Propulsive Systems
response.summary: Mechanical engineer focused on the field of propulsion plants in means of transport. Experience in research projects on IC-engines intended to contribute to the future sustainable mobility. Ability to work autonomously and attention to details.
response.skills: QElectroTech, Research and Analytical Skills, Attention to details, Ability to work autonomously, Autodesk Inventor, MATLAB, Visio, Microsoft Office, OriginPro, Creative Problem Solving, Written and Verbal Communication , Organization Skills, Data Processing and Analysis, Quick Learner, GT-Power, OpenFOAM, VEMOD, Star-CCM+, Ansys Mechanical FEA Software

profile_positions.description: Feasibility study of the oxy-combustion with in-situ oxygen production in a Wärtsilä ship engine.
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer at Air Management Group

profile_positions.company: KAUST (King Abdullah University of Science and Technology)
profile_positions.description: Contribution to the Pre-chamber project funded by Saudi Aramco Company.
profile_positions.title: Intern at Advanced Combustion Engine Group

profile_positions.description: Adaptation of a Go Power Systems dynamometer for performance analysis of a BRIGGS & STRATTON engine
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Intern at IC-Engines Laboratory

education.degree_name: Master's Degree in Propulsive Systems for a Sustainable Mobility

company.name: CMT–Clean Mobility & Thermofluids (UPV)
company.description:
Welcome to CMT-Clean Mobility & Thermofluids, a research centre fully involved in the development of the future propulsion systems, and incorporating more than 100 people. For more than 40 years we have conducted basic research for better understanding the relevant physical processes involved, and applied studies for optimizing the engine behaviour and assisting in its development.

From the deep scientific knowledge to the real-life problems of the automotive industry, we combine experimental tests conducted in our state-of-the-art facilities, and theoretical studies providing relevant technical and scientific results. Our interdisciplinary approach covers different research areas, and aims at Excellence and Innovation. Please, take a look at our website, and do not hesitate to contact us should you have any question or would you be interested in visiting us.
